title: Supreme Court refuses to intervene in anticipatory bail plea by YSRCP MP in A.P. liquor scam case
content: The Bench led by Justice Pardiwala dismisses petition in liquor scam case; MP Midhun Reddy’s counsel terms case ‘politically motivated’

title: Tata Group sets up ₹500 crore welfare trust for Air India plane crash victims
content: The trust's philanthropic activities will also include medical treatment of those who suffered serious injuries and support for rebuilding the B J Medical College Hostel infrastructure, which was damaged in the accident.

title: ASI declares Mizoram’s Lianpui menhirs monument of national importance
content: This is the second megalith site in Mizoram to receive national recognition after ‘Kawtchhuah Ropui’ or Great Entranceway in Vangchhia village

title: Amaravati will emerge as Green Hydrogen Valley, says Chandrababu Naidu
content: The Chief Minister emphasises the urgency to shift from traditional fossil fuels to carbon-free energy sources like green hydrogen, highlighting its potential to reduce costs and benefit the common man

title: Protests erupt over student’s electrocution in Kollam school
content: Decision made to suspend headteacher of the school pending inquiry. An amount of ₹3 lakh will be provided to the family from the Education department’s fund, says Sivankutty

title: NDA government in Andhra Pradesh aiding sand and liquor mafias, alleges CPI
content: Party National Executive member Vanaja accuses Naidu of backtracking on promises of free sand and affordable power; CPI to stage mass protest on August 5

title: India calls for time-bound UNSC reforms, backs 'Pact for the Future' agreement
content: The Pact for the Future is a United Nations agreement adopted at the Summit of the Future in September 2024, aiming to strengthen global cooperation and address current and future challenges

title: NHAI finalises contract for strengthening of 55-km Thanjavur-Pudukottai highway stretch
content: The work has been awarded under the performance-based maintenance contract for the first time in Tamil Nadu under which the contractor would take care of maintenance for five years

title: Ten held for attack on security forces in evicted area of Paikan Reserve Forest: Himanta Biswa Sarma
content: Assam CM claimed that all encroachers have been cleared from the area, where an eviction drive was carried out last week

title: Woman dies in Uttar Pradesh's Baghpat, accusing husband, in-laws of dowry harassment
content: Police said the case is being investigated with seriousness, and efforts are underway to arrest the accused.

title: TMC tried to shield culprits in RG Kar rape and murder case: PM Modi in Bengal
content: The Prime Minister criticises TMC, vows to transform Bengal, launches development projects worth ₹5,400 crore in West Bengal

title: Income Tax Department enables online utility for ITR-2 filing
content: ITR-2 is filed by individuals and HUFs who have income from capital gains, but do not have earnings from business or profession

title: SC nixes PIL against appointment of Bihar Public Service Commission chairperson
content: The top court was critical of PIL and asked the petitioner not to file such bereft of facts petitions

title: Delhi to conduct cloud seeding trials in September to combat air pollution: Environment Minister
content: The trials, earlier planned for early July, were postponed after inputs from the India Meteorological Department (IMD), IIT-Kanpur, and the Indian Institute of Tropical Meteorology (IITM), Pune, indicated that weather conditions in July were not conducive for effective seeding

title: "She's For Russia, It's Allowed": Crowd Assaults Woman In Kyiv Metro
content: A young woman was brutally beaten inside the Kyiv metro in Ukraine for allegedly shouting pro-Russian slogans.

title: "It's Not Child's Play": AAP Leader Says Party Not Part Of INDIA Bloc
content: The Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) distanced itself from the INDIA bloc on Friday, saying it is not part of the opposition alliance anymore and questioning the Congress party's role in leading it.

title: Video: "Keep Your Voice Down," Sharad Pawar's Grandnephew Shouts At Cop
content: Hours after a violent clash at the premises of the Maharashtra Assembly, a heated exchange took place between NCP (Sharad Pawar) faction leader Rohit Pawar and a cop after he, along with party colleague Jitendra Awhad, went to visit a supporter.

title: Meta Apologises After Facebook's Auto-Translation Declared Siddaramaiah Dead
content: Social media giant Meta has apologised after its automatic translation tool erroneously declared Chief Minister Siddaramaiah dead while translating a condolence message posted by the Karnataka CMO in Kannada on Facebook.

title: Full-Time Killer, Part-Time Influencer: Inside Tauseef Badshah's Reel World
content: The man identified as the principal killer in the Bihar hospital murder, 26-year-old Tauseef Badshah of Patna, is not an unknown entity

title: US Faces 70-80% Drop In Indian Students As Visa Crisis Deepens: Report
content: US Universities have witnessed a steep drop in Indian student arrivals. Amid the Trump administration's ongoing crisis with international students, education consultants in Hyderabad have noted that outbound traffic has dipped by 70 per cent.

title: Women Should Be Freed From Regressive Customs, Traditions: Mohan Bhagwat
content: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat on Friday said the empowerment of women is essential for the progress of any nation, and they should be freed from regressive customs and traditions.

title: 8 Amarnath Pilgrims Injured After Truck Hits Car In J&K's Udhampur: Police
content: At least eight Amarnath Yatra pilgrims were injured on Friday when a car was hit by a truck in Jammu and Kashmir's Udhampur district. So far, over 2.52 lakh pilgrims have performed the Amarnath Yatra.

title: 3 Elephants Die After Being Hit By Train While Crossing Railway Track In Bengal
content: Three elephants were hit by a train while crossing a railway track near Bastola railway station in West Bengal. Two baby elephants and one adult died on the spot.

title: "Do Something Quickly": Top Court Asks Centre To Find Russian Woman, Child
content: Victoria Basu, the Russian woman who is missing with her four-year-old child, has not left India through legal channels, the Central government informed the Supreme Court on Friday.

title: Opinion: Opinion | Snapback To Reality: On Iran's 45-Year Slog To Nowhere
content: Vietnam chose wisely. It invited its old enemy to build factories, sign defence pacts and invest in peace. Tehran must decide: does it want to be the next Vietnam - or the next North Korea?

title: Sharad Pawar's Party MLA Faces Case For Obstructing Cops During Clash At Maharashtra Assembly
content: A case has been filed against Sharad Pawar's party MLA, Jitendra Awhad, for obstructing public servants while staging a protest at the Maharashtra Vidhan Bhavan, said the police.

title: "We Act Immediately": Himanta Sarma On Arrests Over Assam Violence
content: Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma, addressing the media at a press conference in Guwahati today, stated that swift action was taken by the Assam Police in response to the violence during the eviction drive in Goalpara.

title: Video: 80-Year-Old Tied To Seat Inside Locked Car As Family Visits Taj Mahal
content: A family from Mumbai travelled to Agra in Uttar Pradesh to see the Taj Mahal. The temperature hovered around 30 degrees Celsius, but humidity was over 90 per cent yesterday.

title: Syrians Find Bodies In Streets While Searching For Loved Ones Amid Clashes
content: A ceasefire went into effect late Wednesday, easing days of brutal clashes in Sweida. Members of its Druze community are returning to search for loved ones and count their losses, finding homes looted and bloodied bodies in the streets.

title: Noida Man's Nose Slashed, Wife Beaten For Scolding Neighbour's Dog
content: Two people were arrested here and a hunt is on for another after they allegedly assaulted their neighbour and cut his nose as the latter scolded the pet dog of one of the accused, Uttar Pradesh Police has said.

title: Rain Lashes Parts Of Delhi, Weather Office Issues Yellow Alert
content: Rains lashed several parts of Delhi on Friday, with the weather department issuing a 'yellow alert' for the national capital.

title: Man Facing Multiple Criminal Cases Shot Dead In Encounter With Police In UP
content: A police encounter in this district on Friday morning resulted in the death of a man, who was accused of kidnapping, rape and murder of an eight-year-old girl, officials said.

title: "Terrorist Treated Better": Imran Khan's Big Charge Against Asim Munir
content: Former Pakistan Prime Minister Imran Khan has asked members of his party, Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf (PTI), to hold Army chief Field Marshal Asim Munir accountable if anything happens to him or his wife, Bushra Bibi, in jail.

title: "Asim Munir Will Know Pain The Day...": Father Of Navy Officer Killed In Pahalgam
content: Lieutenant Vinay Narwal, aged 26, got married on April 16. Less than a week later, he was gunned down by terrorists in Jammu and Kashmir's Pahalgam.

title: BJP hits out at Rahul Gandhi for accusing government of witch-hunt against Robert Vadra
content: BJP national spokesperson Tuhin Sinha alleged that Rahul Gandhi has made it clear that he was "fully aware" of his brother-in-law's "dark deeds" and "might also have been" involved in it

title: Bringing motion to remove Justice Varma matter of MPs, government not in picture, says Arjun Ram Meghwal
content: Arjun Ram Meghwal pointed out that the in-house committee set up by then Chief Justice of India (CJI) Sanjiv Khanna to look into the allegations against Justice Varma has already submitted its report

title: 'Illegal' drugs sale case: Enforcement Directorate raids de-addiction centres in Punjab, Maharashtra
content: “The raids are being conducted in Chandigarh, Ludhiana and Barnala in Punjab and in Mumbai, Maharashtra, under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act,” official sources said

content: Marking 1000 years of King Rajendra Chola’s conquest of the Gangetic plains, an exhibition will also be held at the Brihadisvara temple premises between July 23 and 27.

title: Andhra Pradesh’s SIPB clears investments amounting to ₹39,473 crore
content: The SIPB meetings held so far, including the 8th one, have approved 109 projects with a total investment of ₹5,74,238 crore

title: Pregnant tribal woman, missing for 10 days over fear of hospital delivery, returns home in Erode
content: Shevanthi’s return followed persistent efforts by S. Kannaiyan, president of the Thalavadi Farmers’ Foundation, who counselled her family on the importance of institutional delivery

title: Congress MPs will be among signatories: Jairam Ramesh on proposed motion against Justice Varma in Lok Sabha
content: Jairam Ramesh also stressed that the Opposition would strongly push the issue of Justice Shekhar Yadav, against whom 55 Opposition MPs moved an impeachment notice in the Rajya Sabha last December for allegedly delivering a hate speech at a gathering last year.

title: Deep cracks in ground prompt evacuation in Kerala’s Kasaragod; soil piping suspected
content: Cracks, reportedly over two metres deep, appear in multiple spots at Kajaey in Vorkady panchayat, causing a section of land to collapse

title: A year after cyberattack, WazirX investors are waiting for legal woes to end
content: Though it has been a year since a hacked multi-signature wallet cost the exchange more than $230 million, WazirX investors are unable to access their locked-up crypto

title: SC refuses to intervene in appeal by Lalu Prasad for stay of trial
content: The case pertains to alleged transfer of land parcels to Lalu Prasad and his associates for job in Railways during his tenure as Union Minister

title: Rahul Gandhi asks Congress workers to emulate model set by former Kerala CM Oommen Chandy
content: Inaugurating a public meeting as part of second death anniversary of Oommen Chandy at Puthuppally, Rahul Gandhi expresses his aspiration to nurture more leaders such as the former CM and tells leaders to ‘touch the feelings of the people to become a leader’

title: Rahul Gandhi accuses RSS, CPI(M) of lacking empathy for the people
content: Congress leader says the ‘real tragedy in Indian politics today is that very few people are actually feeling what others are feeling’

content: Acting on a complaint on fake HUID, the team led by BIS Joint Director T. Arjun, conducted a raid on Sri Lakshmi Hallmarking Centre, located at Narsannapeta in Srikakulam district

title: Indigenous diving support vessel Nistar Commissioned at Vishakapatnam
content: Nistar is both technologically and operationally significant, enhancing India’s and regional partners’ submarine rescue capabilities, with India set to emerge as a preferred partner in submarine rescue globally, said the CNS.

title: Andaman cooperative bank scam: Former Congress MP Kuldeep Sharma arrested
content: Kuldeep Sharma, who formerly served as the chairman of ANSCBL, was arrested from a private hospital in Port Blair where he was admitted owing to health issues

title: Congress brass unhappy over MLAs not opposing public security Bill in Assembly

title: Platform fees now an ‘industry standard,’ an ‘inevitable’ development
content: As e-commerce and quick-commerce firms seek to turn their scale into profitability, platform fees have, in a matter of months, gone from a small experiment on Swiggy to something that even Amazon charges to Indian customers.

title: Banayenge Naya Bihar, Phir ek baar NDA Sarkar, cries PM Modi at Motihari public meeting in Bihar

title: Mamata Banerjee only concerned about Bengali-speaking Muslims: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma
content: CM Himanta Biswa Sarma cautioned Mamata Banerjee that if she comes to Assam for the sake of Muslim-Bengalis, Assamese and Hindu-Bengalis will "not spare her"

title: Police initiate probe into 'recruitment irregularities' in Meghalaya
content: The investigation was initiated following an internal scrutiny and official correspondence with the Staff Selection Commission (SSC) and the CGCA, they said.

content: Attorney-General  R. Venkataramani expressed the government’s concern to bring Nimisha Priya back home safely. “All the government can do is being done,” he said

title: Three elephants run over by train in West Bengal’s Jhargram
content: Forest department say they had notified the railways three hours prior to the accident about usual elephant movement; railway officials did not comment on the allegations

title: Kerala University V-C Mohanan Kunnummal returns amid tight security; SFI refrains from protesting on campus

title: Two militants arrested in Manipur for extortion activities
content: The moves follows the search operations  being conducted by security forces across Manipur since ethnic violence erupted two years ago.

title: Panic in Bengaluru as 15 private schools receive bomb threat emails

title: Rahul Gandhi extends support to his brother-in-law Robert Vadra amid ED chargesheet
content: I stand with Robert, Priyanka and their children as they face yet another onslaught of malicious, politically motivated slander and harassment, says Congress leader Rahul Gandhi.

content: Kerala State Commission for Protection of Child Rights chairperson says authorities glossed over danger posed by low-tension power line that sagged dangerously close to awning of school building

title: Why are Ola, Uber, Rapido drivers’ striking work in Mumbai?
content: Cab services in Mumbai have remained disrupted for a third consecutive day as Ola and Uber drivers continue their indefinite strike, demanding higher per-kilometre fares, reduced commission charges, and immediate government intervention.

title: India non-committal on revival of Russia-India-China framework
content: Official sources said no meeting of the RIC format has been agreed to at this point in time and there are no discussions underway on its scheduling

title: Petrol bombs hurled at school vehicles after class X student’s death in Tirunelveli
content: The police said a Class X student from Maanaabharananallur was reportedly censured by his teachers for “behaving in an unruly manner” and “not studying well” on July 4. Upset over this, he attempted suicide on July 7 on the school premises and died on Thursday

title: Justice Yashwant Varma moves Supreme Court against panel report
content: The inquiry panel had said “strong inferential evidence” established that the burnt currency was removed by Justice Varma’s trusted staff from the storeroom during the early hours of March 15

title: 'What is guarantee Rahul Gandhi won't be jailed before I am', says Himanta
content: Coming to a State and saying whom he will send to jail or not is unbefitting of a national leader... It proves how important I am, says Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma

title: India welcomes U.S. listing of The Resistance Front as global terrorist outfit
content: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar described Washington's decision on The Resistance Force (TRF) as a "strong affirmation" of India-U.S. counter-terrorism cooperation

title: One dead, 3 injured as school building’s roof collapses in Ranchi
content: Operation is underway to rescue three persons trapped under the debris at the school in Piska More area in Ranchi

title: What does the August 2025 U.S. Visa Bulletin mean for Indian applicants?
content: The August 2025 U.S. Visa Bulletin presents key updates for Indian applicants, with advancements in the EB-5 and EB-3 categories and no movement in family-based visas.

title: King Rajendra Chola’s military expedition to the Gangetic plains that inspired the building of Gangaikonda Cholapuram
content: During the expedition, Rajendra Chola I defeated several kings and chieftains. The king celebrated the victory by assuming the title ‘Gangaikonda Cholan’. He also built Gangaikonda Cholapuram in the present-day Ariyalur district, along with the Gangaikonda Cholisvaram, the Shiva temple that was the jewel in his crown

title: The four copper plate inscriptions that detail reign, deeds of King Rajendra Chola
content: Among the most valuable records from Rajendra’s time are four sets of copper plate inscriptions discovered at different locations. The Tiruvalangadu Copper Plates, the Karanthai Copper Plates, the Tirukkalar Copper Plates, and the Esalam Copper Plates highlight the Chola lineage, temple endowments, and military expeditions

title: Chola Gangam lake, a 1000-year-old symbol of Rajendra Chola’s victory, lies in ruins in Ariyalur
content: Near Brihadisvara Temple in Ariyalur district of Tamil Nadu lies Chola Gangam, a tank spread over 17 km. It had once occupied 16 miles. Prime Minister Narendra  Modi’s proposed visit on July 27 and the plan to release a commemorative coin will likely spotlight the condition of the tank

title: Three-storey building collapses in Bandra east; seven injured
content: Teams from Mumbai Fire Brigade (MFB Level-II), BMC, Police, MHADA, PWD, Adani, and other civic agencies have been mobilised

title: Over 5 lakh applications received so far for 35,726 teacher posts in Bengal schools: WBSSC
content: Notification for fresh recruitment was issued on May 30 in adherence to a directive by the Supreme Court

title: For every child free for adoption in India, 13 parents wait in line: Data
content: The average delay for prospective parents to get an adoption referral in India has increased to over three years

title: Budameru floods: a trauma that refuses to subside
content: In August 2024, Budameru floods wreaked havoc on Vijayawada, submerging homes and taking lives. A year into the disaster, residents continue to grapple with loss and a lingering dread for another deluge. Nellore Sravani speaks to the people who are limping back to normalcy and finds out the status of an ambitious project aimed at ending the generational trauma

title: Fresh batch of over 7,900 pilgrims leaves Jammu for Amarnath after one-day suspension
content: With this, a total of 1,09,461 pilgrims have departed from the Jammu base camp for the Valley since July 2, when Lieutenant Governor Manoj Sinha flagged off the first batch

title: 'You've got to thread it': Why hole No. 1 is playing a big part in this year's Open Championship

title: Sources: Steelers make Watt highest-paid non-QB

content: e-Paper The View From India Looking at World Affairs from the Indian perspective . first day first show news and reviews from the world of cinema and streaming . the weekly newsletter from science writers takes the jargon out of science and puts the fun in!

title: Visa crisis: US universities could see 70% drop in Indian students this fall; here's why
content: American universities anticipate a significant drop in Indian students this fall due to visa appointment freezes and increased rejection rates. Students are facing uncertainty and exploring alternative countries like Germany as visa slots remain scarce. The US Consulate General in Hyderabad assures that slots have resumed, but heightened scrutiny is causing anxiety and application withdrawals.

title: 'Majboori hai': MP claims BJP may not win 150 seats without PM Modi
content: BJP MP Nishikant Dubey emphasized PM Modi's crucial role in the party's electoral triumphs, asserting that without PM Modi's leadership, the BJP might struggle to secure even 150 seats. He highlighted how PM Modi's popularity has drawn in previously unsupportive voter segments, particularly among the poor.

title: 'Lies and loot': PM attacks Mamata govt; says Bengal youth forced to migrate
content: PM Narendra Modi criticized the Trinamool Congress government. He accused them of fostering lawlessness and loot in West Bengal. Modi claimed people are turning to the BJP for hope. He highlighted the lack of job opportunities. Modi promised economic transformation if the BJP wins. He questioned the state's investment environment citing violence and bias.

title: IND vs ENG: When will India begin preparations in Manchester for 4th Test?
content: Following a narrow defeat at Lord's, Shubman Gill and the Indian team have arrived in Manchester for a crucial fourth Test against England, starting July 23. With England leading the series 2-1, India faces a must-win situation. Preparations include optional and full training sessions, with media interactions scheduled to address the pressure and strategies for a comeback.

title: How 5 shooters dodged checkpoints at Patna hospital, killed gangster in 30 seconds
content: The daylight murder of gangster Chandan Mishra within Patna's Paras HMRI, while on parole for medical treatment, has triggered a major security review. Five unmasked assailants executed the crime swiftly, raising concerns about potential security lapses and staff involvement. Authorities are investigating how the armed attackers bypassed checkpoints, with suspicion falling on possible reconnaissance and internal collusion.

title: Amazon sets new requirements for employee promotions in 'these' departments
content: Ring founder Jamie Siminoff mandates AI usage demonstration for employee promotions within the RBKS organization, including Ring, Blink, and Key. This initiative aims to foster innovation, efficiency, and align with Amazon's broader focus on AI-driven productivity. Employees must showcase AI's impact on customer experience and operational improvements to advance their careers.

title: Air India crash: Tata Group launches Rs 500 crore trust for victims’ families
content: Following the Air India Flight AI-171 crash in Ahmedabad, Tata Group has established 'The AI-171 Memorial and Welfare Trust' with a corpus of Rs 500 crore. The trust aims to support the victims' families and those affected by the tragedy.

title: Exclusive | Divyanshi, first Indian in 36 years to win historic gold, 'really scared' of a school challenge
content: Divyanshi Bhowmick, a 14-year-old table tennis prodigy, recently made history by winning the U-15 girls’ singles crown at the Asian Youth Table Tennis Championships after 36 years. Despite her remarkable achievements and world ranking, she faces a different kind of challenge: the upcoming Class 10 board exams. She is 'really scared' of it.

title: Perplexity CEO says Google ‘a giant bureaucratic organization’
content: Perplexity's CEO, Aravind Srinivas, challenges Google's reliance on ads. He believes it hinders AI integration. Srinivas anticipates Google will adopt features from Perplexity's Comet browser. He also criticizes Google's organizational structure. Comet, an AI-powered browser, prioritizes users. It is currently available to premium Perplexity subscribers. A free version is planned. Srinivas aims to challenge Google's market dominance.

title: Watch | FIR filed against Shami's estranged wife; video of scuffle goes viral
content: Hasin Jahan, the estranged wife of Mohammed Shami, and her daughter Arshi Jahan are facing serious charges, including attempted murder, after a violent clash with a neighbour, Dalia Khatoon, in Suri, West Bengal. The dispute arose over a contested plot of land, leading to a physical altercation that resulted in Dalia's hospitalisation and a police investigation following the viral video.

title: Trump targets Fed Chair again, calls on 'too late, numbskull’ to lower rates
content: Donald Trump has escalated his criticism of Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell, accusing him of stalling the housing market with high interest rates. Trump hinted at a possible dismissal over a controversial $2.5 billion renovation at the Fed's headquarters, branding Powell a "numbskull.

title: 'MS Dhoni and I were ...': Yuvraj nearly missed 2011 WC; Kirsten opens up
content: Gary Kirsten revealed Yuvraj Singh's selection for the 2011 World Cup team wasn't guaranteed, with Kirsten and MS Dhoni advocating for his inclusion due to his experience. Despite a quiet 2010, Yuvraj delivered a stellar performance, scoring 362 runs and taking 15 wickets. His crucial contributions helped India win the tournament, earning him the Player of the Tournament award.

title: Coldplay concert viral video: Astronomer CEO caught on kiss cam; Musk reacts
content: A video of Astronomer CEO Andy Byron and HR head Kristin Cabot kissing at a Coldplay concert has gone viral, sparking online chatter dubbed "Coldplaygate." The incident, captured on a kiss cam, led to speculation about workplace relationships. Elon Musk reacted to a morphed apology tweet with a laughing emoji, further fueling the controversy.

title: EU imposes sanctions on Rosneft's India refinery - how it may benefit India
content: The EU has intensified sanctions against Russia, targeting oil revenues and military capabilities due to the Ukraine conflict. These measures impact a Rosneft-owned Indian refinery and lower the oil price ceiling, potentially benefiting India through cheaper crude.

title: 'Joke is on him': Himanta reacts to Rahul's 'jail' remark; shows 'thenga'
content: Following Rahul Gandhi's claim that Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma would face jail time for alleged corruption, Sarma responded sharply, asserting his Assamese identity and dismissing Gandhi's remarks as detached from reality. Sarma linked Gandhi's visit to violent clashes during an eviction drive in Goalpara, accusing him of encouraging encroachment.

title: From Rahul Dravid to Cheteshwar Pujara to who now? India's No. 3 question remains unanswered
content: India have had steady options in Rahul Dravid and Cheteshwar Pujara in the No. 3 spot over the years. That all-important role is in limbo during this transition period. In the three Tests in England, Sai Sudharsan and Karun Nair have held the roles but not made it their own - just yet.

title: Report: Luka Doncic may shun Lakers over how team treated LeBron James
content: Luka Doncic's future with the Los Angeles Lakers is uncertain as he approaches a player option in 2025-26. Tension arises from the Lakers' apparent shift towards prioritizing Doncic over LeBron James, potentially alienating the Slovenian star. Concerns grow that the Lakers' treatment of James could impact Doncic's trust and willingness to commit long-term.

title: Leafs eye bigger trade splash after Marner exit rocks NHL offseason
content: The Toronto Maple Leafs continue to stir NHL headlines following Mitch Marner’s trade to the Vegas Golden Knights. With offensive gaps to fill, speculation is mounting around a potential blockbuster deal. General manager Brad Treliving has made several smaller moves, but could be plotting a bigger swing as Toronto looks to remain competitive in the National Hockey League.

title: Suni Lee shuts down OG Anunoby romance talk: ‘We’re just friends’
content: American gymnast Suni Lee clarified that she is not dating New York Knicks star OG Anunoby. Rumors began after Lee attended the East Conference Finals. She stated that their interactions were misinterpreted by social media. Lee mentioned she is friends with several Knicks players, including Karl-Anthony Towns. She enjoys watching basketball and that is why she attended the games.

title: Sidney Crosby trade buzz grows — Canadiens & Avalanche emerge top suitors — Penguins insist he stays
content: Sidney Crosby's future with the Pittsburgh Penguins is uncertain amidst rebuild speculation and Evgeni Malkin's potential departure. Trade rumors link Crosby to the Montreal Canadiens and Colorado Avalanche, fueled by his friendship with Nathan MacKinnon and ties to Montreal. Despite the buzz, Crosby remains focused, but his long-term security in Pittsburgh is questioned.

title: Siddaramaiah 'death' post: Meta apologises for Kannada post blunder
content: Meta has apologized to Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah after its Kannada translation tool made a serious error. The tool inaccurately translated a condolence message about actress B Sarojadevi's death. The translation error caused public outrage. Siddaramaiah criticized Meta for the faulty translation. He also warned citizens about translation inaccuracies.

title: Golden Temple threat mails: Techie detained; devices seized for probe
content: Shubham Dubey, a software engineer, has been detained by Amritsar Police for allegedly sending threatening emails to the SGPC, warning of a bomb attack on the Golden Temple. The emails, received over three days, claimed planned explosive attacks at Sri Harmandir Sahib.

title: Coldplay scandal: Astronomer CEO's senior says 'hasn’t learned his lesson'
content: The Coldplay concert 'kiss cam' incident involving Astronomer CEO Andy Byron and Chief People Officer Kristin Cabot has spiraled into a major controversy. A man claiming to be Byron's childhood acquaintance accused him of bullying. The scandal intensified after Byron's wife reportedly removed 'Byron' from her Facebook name, sparking widespread online support for her amidst the infidelity allegations.

title: Watch: Day after assembly brawl, MLA Rohit Pawar loses cool at Mumbai police station
content: Maharashtra MLA Rohit Pawar confronted a police officer at Mumbai’s Azad Maidan police station following confusion over the whereabouts of an injured party worker, Nitin Deshmukh. Pawar and NCP (SP) MLA Jitendra Awhad were searching for Deshmukh, allegedly assaulted by BJP MLC Gopichand Padalkar's supporters. A video shows Pawar visibly angry, accusing the police of being unhelpful and evasive.

title: Conversion racket: ED raids Chhangur Baba’s network in UP, Mumbai
content: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) conducted searches at 14 locations linked to Chhangur Baba, the alleged mastermind of a religious conversion syndicate, following a PMLA case. These searches, spanning Balrampur and Mumbai, uncovered a suspected Rs 100-crore foreign funding racket. Investigations revealed suspicious transactions, foreign remittances, and illegal land deals potentially financing mass religious conversions.

title: How overworked are Indian bowlers even as Stokes bowls 100-plus overs
content: Ben Stokes' high workload in the Test series has reignited the debate over player management, contrasting with India's cautious approach with Jasprit Bumrah. While Stokes bowls long spells despite injury risks, Bumrah's workload is carefully managed to preserve him for future matches. Critics question if India's strategy is too restrictive, especially in crucial moments, as the series intensifies.

title: Dogs hit the waves: Canines gear up for World Dog Surfing Championships — California beach to host
content: Get ready for a pawsome spectacle! On August 2, 2025, Linda Mar Beach in Pacifica, California, will host the World Dog Surfing Championships. Dogs of all sizes will compete for the Golden Surfie Award, showcasing their wave-riding skills. The event features a dog fashion show, rescue dog adoptions, and charity activities, promising a fun-filled day for all.

title: Patna hospital murder: New footage shows gunmen celebrating on street
content: Following the brazen daylight execution of a murder convict inside Patna's Paras Hospital, new footage has emerged showing the suspected killers celebrating their act openly on the streets, brandishing a firearm. The incident, captured on CCTV, has ignited outrage over Bihar's deteriorating law and order situation, prompting political accusations and demands for stricter governance.

title: Ex-India coach makes honest Bumrah admission: 'If he wants rest, he doesn't need to ...'
content: As India gear up for the crucial fourth Test against England, the participation of ace pacer Jasprit Bumrah remains uncertain. Former coach Anil Kumble strongly advocates for Bumrah's inclusion, emphasizing the must-win nature of the match. Assistant coach Ryan ten Doeschate hints at leaning towards playing Bumrah, acknowledging the series is at stake.

title: Nifty50 closes below 25,000; BSE Sensex down over 500 points
content: Stock market today: The NSE Nifty decreased by 143.05 points or 0.57 per cent, ending at 24,968.40. The BSE Sensex fell by 501.51 points or 0.61 per cent, closing at 81,757.73. During trading, it reached a low of 81,608.13, down by 651.11 points or 0.79 per cent.

title: 'Thanks for the gift': Ex-Chhattisgarh CM Baghel’s son arrested; ED crackdown comes on his birthday
content: Chaitanya Baghel, son of ex-Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel, got arrested by the Enforcement Directorate. This arrest relates to the alleged liquor scam in Chhattisgarh. Raids occurred at Baghel's residence in Bhilai. Baghel criticized PM Modi, linking the arrest to his son's birthday. The ED alleges a Rs 2,161 crore scam involving government officials and liquor businessmen.

title: PM Modi says 'took resolve of Op Sindoor from Bihar'; takes jibe at Lalu - top quotes
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi, during his visit to East Champaran, lauded Operation Sindoor's success and contrasted his government's development initiatives with the previous RJD era, accusing them of neglecting Bihar. He inaugurated projects worth over ₹7,200 crore and flagged off Amrit Bharat trains.

title: Sanctions on Russia: EU unveils strong measures; oil cap lowered, shadow fleet hit
content: The EU has intensified sanctions against Russia, targeting oil revenues with a reduced price cap of $45 per barrel and banning dealings related to the Nord Stream gas pipelines. These measures aim to constrict Russia's financial capabilities and limit its ability to fund the war in Ukraine.

title: 'Veg items only': Hindu Raksha Dal protests at Ghaziabad KFC
content: Hindu Raksha Dal members protested outside a KFC in Ghaziabad, demanding it stop serving non-vegetarian food during the Kanwar Yatra. Protesters shouted religious slogans, forced the outlet to close, and insisted on vegetarian-only service during Shravan. Police have registered an FIR against unidentified individuals for violating public order and disobeying regulations.

title: INS Nistar commissioned: India's first indigenous deep-sea rescue ship; joins elite global club
content: The Indian navy has commissioned INS Nistar, a diving support vessel. It happened at Visakhapatnam naval dockyard. Hindustan shipyard limited built the vessel. INS Nistar can handle deep-sea diving and rescue operations. The vessel can also act as a mother ship for the navy’s deep submergence rescue vessel. The ship's components are mostly indigenous.

title: 'Tried to belittle Marathi': Raj Thackeray slams assembly brawl; defends MNS 'soldiers'
content: MNS chief Raj Thackeray criticized the recent violence in the Maharashtra Assembly, decrying the decline in political decorum and demanding accountability. He questioned the obsession with power and the silence of critics who usually target MNS workers. Thackeray also warned against wasting public funds on such incidents and the potential for future escalation, urging impartial action from the state government.

title: IND vs ENG: 'Avoidable shoulder bump' - India batter fined; England team penalised
content: India opener Pratika Rawal faced a fine of 10% of her match fee for inappropriate physical contact during the first ODI against England, breaching the ICC Code of Conduct twice. Additionally, she received a demerit point. England's team was also penalised, incurring a five percent fine for a slow over rate.

title: India and France: Govt pitches Rs 61,000 cr deal for next gen fighter engine
content: India's Defence Ministry is reportedly pushing for a collaboration with France to develop next-generation fighter jet engines, aiming for self-reliance in this critical technology. The ₹61,000 crore initiative seeks to create a 120kn engine for future platforms like the AMCA.

title: Howell Jr. steps down as NFLPA chief: Conflict of interest, sealed rulings spark outrage
content: Lloyd Howell Jr. abruptly resigned as NFL Players Association executive director amidst controversy. His ties to The Carlyle Group, a private equity firm with NFL ownership connections, and a confidentiality agreement with the league raised trust issues. Additionally, his involvement with OneTeam Partners, under federal investigation, and a past sexual discrimination lawsuit further fueled internal discontent, leading to his departure.

title: 12 month ban, Rs 8.20 lakh fine! Ex-England star penalised for drink-driving
content: Former England captain Paul Ince has been handed a ban for being caught driving over the legal alcohol limit in Cheshire. The incident occurred on June 28. A police officer witnessed Ince's car swerving. The ex-Liverpool, Manchester United player admitted to having consumed two drinks before driving.

title: IND vs ENG: 'He has to play' - Ex-Eng cricketer bats for Bumrah in must-win 4th Test
content: Monty Panesar urges India to unleash Jasprit Bumrah in the crucial fourth Test against England, emphasising its "must-win" importance. He questions Arshdeep Singh's exclusion, highlighting his potential impact with left-arm seam. While Bumrah's workload is a concern, Team India leans towards playing him in Manchester, but Arshdeep's hand injury adds selection uncertainty.

title: AAP disengages from INDIA bloc, says alliance was only for 2024 LS polls
content: AAP has declared its departure from the INDIA bloc, asserting that the alliance served its purpose during the 2024 Lok Sabha elections. The party alleged a covert, corrupt agreement between the BJP and Congress, accusing them of prioritizing mutual political survival over public welfare.

title: Solar Eclipse 2025: 6 minutes of total darkness- when and where to watch
content: Get ready for a celestial spectacle. On August 2, 2027, a total solar eclipse will grace Europe, North Africa, and the Middle East. The Moon will completely block the Sun for up to six minutes. This event is the longest total solar eclipse visible from land in over a century. Prime viewing spots include Libya and Egypt.

title: T.J. Watt signs extension with Pittsburgh Steelers- brother reacts hilariously;
content: T.J. Watt, the star defensive player, has signed a massive 3-year contract extension with the Pittsburgh Steelers. The deal makes him the highest-paid non-quarterback in NFL history with career earnings crossing $255 million. His brother, J.J. Watt, reacted with pride and humor. This move is crucial for the Steelers as they aim for a resurgence.

title: What we're hearing in the transfer window: Sancho, Rashford headed to Juve?
content: the transfer window is open across Europe, and business is starting to get done . sportsmail's reporters hear about possible deals every Friday until September . it's highly unlikely that Juventus will get both players, for a number of reasons .

title: If the College Football Playoff isn't broken, why fix it?
content: college football's opposition to an expanded, let alone expansive, playoff is dead and buried . the 81-year-old retired just this week after a second stint leading west Virginia University . plans to move from 12 participants to 16 were underway before last season's inaugural 12-teamer even took place .

content: the 2025 WNBA All-Star Game reaches its 26-year milestone this weekend . caitlin Clark and Napheesa Collier are team captains after finishing as the top two fan vote-getters . each of them drafted their respective team on July 8 setting the stage for a matchup .

title: The Next Episode: Snoop invests in Swansea City
content: the former premier league club didn't disclose financial details in the announcement . the rapper and entertainment icon helped launch the team's 2025-26 home shirt last weekend . he also took a playful jab at owner Ryan Reynolds during the launch .

title: The 20 most interesting storylines at NFL training camps
content: christmas is in December, is four weeks long and comes with a present nearly every single day . it's just around the corner, with veteran players for the Chargers and Lions reporting to camp . there's little I look forward to more than the first video to hit my timeline .

title: Joel Embiid sees you
content: Kendrick Perkins: Embiid feels pressured to play through injury showcases trust issues . he says he's leaning back on a couch that seemed spacious until he eased his long body onto it . his son, Arthur, peeks around corners from the hallway to see what we're up to .

title: Dear 'Diamond': Letters to Dustin Poirier on the eve of his final UFC fight
content: Dustin Poirier will make his final walk to the UFC Octagon against Max Holloway . the 36-year-old says he has decided to walk away to preserve his long-term health . poirier is considered one of the top lightweights in the world, ranked no. 5 in ESPN's divisional rankings .

title: Govt not involved in Justice Varma impeachment move: Law minister Meghwal
content: the TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide . the team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics .

title: 'Nothing formal can happen right now': Centre to SC on nurse execution case
content: the TOI News Desk is your trusted source for staying informed and connected to the ever-evolving global landscape . the team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics .
